articles.title: UK house prices increase at fastest rate since 2004 - The Guardian
articles.description: High demand and low supply could create conditions for housing super-boom, says Nationwide
articles.content:
House prices in April rose at the fastest rate since 2004 as the UK faces a potential sales super-boom, with buyers rushing to take advantage of the extension of the governments stamp duty holiday.
